qas.question: What type of government did Espartero have?
Who ended up getting most of Valencia's church property?
Whose troops threatened reprisals in Valencia?

context: During the regency of Maria Cristina, <a0_0>Espartero<a0_0/> ruled Spain for two years as its 18th Prime Minister from <a1_0>16 September 1840 to 21 May 1841<a1_0/>. Under his <a2_0>progressive<a2_0/> government the old regime was tenuously reconciled to his liberal policies. During this period of upheaval in the provinces he declared that all the estates of the Church, its congregations, and its religious orders were national property—though in Valencia, most of this property was subsequently acquired by the <a3_0>local bourgeoisie<a3_0/>. City life in Valencia carried on in a revolutionary climate, with frequent clashes between liberals and republicans, and the constant threat of reprisals by the Carlist troops of <a4_0>General Cabrera<a4_0/>.
